tool.name: CalculateRoadDensityNearStreams

param.name: in_watershed
param.dialogReference: This layer represents the watershed in the region of interest that the user will specify. It will be the source layer that will contain the unique identifier to join geoprocessing results to.

param.name: in_watershed_id
param.dialogReference: The field within the “Watershed Boundaries” layer that will be summarized and processed into the resulting output table and report. This is another user defined field.

param.name: in_streams
param.dialogReference: The streams that are currently flowing through the elk valley region. This can be any water layer the user wants to define depending on the study and region of interest.

param.name: in_roads
param.dialogReference: All roads that are currently in place within the region of interest. These include highways, main roads, arterial roads, access roads, resource roads, etc. The user can define this layer as they see fit for the purposes of the study.

param.name: in_distance
param.dialogReference: The buffer distance away from a stream, the “Existing Streams” layer, that will be used to intersect the roads within this region.

param.name: in_proposed_roads
param.dialogReference: New roads that are to be constructed in the future. This is a new development layer that the user can define as it is appropriate for the purposes of their study. This will represent the new road densities as a result of new developments.

param.name: out_folder
param.dialogReference: The file path that the resulting mxd and pdf will be saved to. This will contain the resulting GDB with watershed polygon and results table.

tool.summary: This tool is designed to calculate the road densities within a close proximity to streams in a watershed. By taking the existing road density and after taking into consideration the newly proposed developments, a simple python tool will produce visual and statistical variables to assist with the analysis for the cumulative effects hazard calculations.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool is designed to calculate the road densities within a close proximity to streams in a watershed. By taking the existing road density and after taking into consideration the newly proposed developments, a simple python tool will produce visual and statistical variables to assist with the analysis for the cumulative effects hazard calculations.

Consts.useLimit: The tool has been provided solely for the purposes for evaluation of HARTerra’s capabilities for creating such tools as part of the RFP process (Ministry of Forests, Lands, Natural Resource Operations and Rural Development RFP GS20KBR002/1070-20 Cumulative Effects Hazard Calculator Tool) and may not be distributed or used for any purpose outside of the RFP evaluation process.
